member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeEditors.DisplayNameAttribute
member.summary: DisplayNameAttribute overwrites the property name for the property grid.
member.remarks:
If the string is empty the PropertyDescriptor tries to use the resource file to gather the string for displaying.
If the string is not empty the resource manager tries to gather the information from the given name instead of the attribute (property) name. This allows the usage of different properties with the same name.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeEditors.ScriptCollectionEditor
member.summary: ScriptCollectionEditor lets the user edit script blocks outside the editor using the PropertyGrid.
member.remarks:
This editor is used to support the PropertyGrid. You should not use this class directly from user code as far as you don't write your own PropertyGrid support.
This is a System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor derived class changing some of the base features via reflection.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeEditors.ScriptCollectionEditor.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Instantiates the collection editor the first time.
member.remarks: This method supports the NetRix infrastructure and should not beeing used from user code.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeEditors.ScriptCollectionEditor.CreateCollectionForm
member.summary: Takes the base collection form and apply some changes.
member.remarks: This method uses reflection to change the internal collection editor dialog on-thy-fly.
member.returns: The changed form is beeing returned completely.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeEditors.ScriptCollectionEditor.CanRemoveInstance(System.Object)
member.summary: Prohibits the removing of instances.
member.remarks:
The purpose of this method is to avoid the user from removing script blocks using the collection editor. This is necessary because the user cannot recognize the real position of the script fragment within the HTML page using this editor. Removing and adding can cause scripting errors because JavaScript and VBScript fragments depends on their position of the page.
It is recommended to replace the script editing features with a more sophisticated solution based on the DOM instead of using this editor in a real life environment. The purpose of this editor is to have an fast and simple access to the script fragments on the page without any programming tasks required.
member.param: The current value. Not beeing used here.
member.returns: Returns always false to prohibit instance removing.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeEditors.ScriptCollectionEditor.CanSelectMultipleInstances
member.summary: Prohibits the selection of multiple instances.
member.remarks: It is not allowed to edit multiple instances of the script editor at the same time.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeEditors.UIUrlEditor
member.summary: This delegate allows the host application to define a dialog which is called whenever the propertygrid edits a src or href attribute where an URL or file can selected.
member.remarks: If no callback exists the standard openFileDialog control will be used. The signature accepts a string (the old value in propertgrid item) and gets a string back as the new item.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeEditors.UIUnitEditor
member.summary: This delegate allows the host application to define a dialog which is called whenever the propertygrid edits a attribute containing a unit (pixel or percentage value).
member.remarks: If no callback exists the UnitEditor control will be used. The signature accepts a string (the old value in propertgrid item) and gets a string back as the new item.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeEditors.UIPixelEditor
member.summary: This delegate allows the host application to define a dialog which is called whenever the propertygrid edits a attribute containing a unit (pixel or percentage value).
member.remarks: If no callback exists the UnitEditor control will be used. The signature accepts a string (the old value in propertgrid item) and gets a string back as the new item.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeEditors.UIAngleEditor
member.summary: This delegate allows the host application to define a dialog which is called whenever the propertygrid edits a attribute containing an angle (in degrees between 0 and 360).
member.remarks: If no callback exists the AngleEditor control will be used. The signature accepts a string (the old value in propertgrid item) and gets a string back as the new item.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeEditors.UIColorEditor
member.summary: This delegate allows the host application to define a dialog which is called whenever the propertygrid edits a attribute containing a color.
member.remarks: If no callback exists the control will be used. The signature accepts a string (the old value in propertgrid item) and gets a string back as the new item.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeEditors.UIFontEditor
member.summary: This delegate allows the host application to define a dialog which is called whenever the propertygrid edits a attribute containing a font.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeEditors.UIStyleEditor
member.summary: This delegate allows the host application to define a dialog which is called whenever the propertygrid edits a attribute containing a style definition.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeEditors.UIScriptEditor

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeEditors.UIIntEditor

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeConverters.UITypeConverterDropList
member.summary: This class provides a type converter to convert dropdown lists to divide the UI (language) from the internal value. It handles dropdown lists generated from enum or boolean values. In the resource file the descriptor has the format "PropertyGrid.XXX" whereas "XXX" is the name of the enum type or the string "Boolean". The type is given with its name only, without any part of the namespace.

member.summary: Check what this type can be created from

member.returns: Always true.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeConverters.UITypeConverterDropList.GetStandardValues(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext)
member.summary: Get the collection of default values for the list.
member.remarks:
For boolean types a short list with the values "true" and "false" will be created.
Use this attribute to get this typeconverter working: [TypeConverter(typeof(GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeConverters.UITypeConverterDropList))]
member.param: Context from which the editor is called.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeConverters.UITypeConverterDropList.GetStandardValuesExclusive(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext)
member.summary: This method returns always true and does not allow the user to enter own values for droplists.
member.remarks: This behavior can be modified by detecting the property name and decide to return false instead.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeConverters.UITypeConverterDropList.ConvertFrom(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the localized version of the current value into underlying system type.
member.remarks: For boolean values, treated here as a collection of two list elements (which represent true and false), the resource must return the text for "true" as first value, the text for "false" as second one.
member.param: Context from which the editor is called.
The current UI culture.
The value from which the converter converts.
member.returns: The value into which the converter has the input converted.

member.summary: Convert the given value from a enum or bool field into the localized version.
member.remarks: The boolean values are treated as some special kind of enum, because we display the values as dropdownlist containing "Yes" or "No" list elements.
member.param: Context from which the editor is called.
The current UI culture.
The value beeing converted.
The type to which the converter converts the value.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.TypeConverters.UITypeConverterMetaEnum
member.summary: This class is a type converter used to convert the META tag enumerations into strings.
member.remarks:
It preserves different (customized) strings. The droplist created contains the following META tag names (hardcoded). First, the list of named META tags:
Robots
Description
Keywords
Author
Generator
Formatter
Classification
Copyright
Rating
Note: The NetRix component will nether set the "Generator" META tag internally. If you want your application set this tag this must be done programmatically.
Second, the list of HTTP-Equiv META tags. These tags creating HTTP equivalent headers sent to the browser.
Content-Disposition
Expires
Pragma
Content-Type
Content-ScriptType
Content-StyleType
Default-Style
Content-Language
Refresh
Window-Target
ExtCache
SetCookie
PICSLabel
Cache-Control
Vary

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.ColorPicker.ColorPanel.GetPreferredWidth
member.summary:
When the ColorPanel is being resized GetPreferredWidth is called to determine the preferred width. For ColorPanel the preferred width is the control's default Width, i.e the control may be resized.
Derived classes, such as ColorPanelWithCapture may override this.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.ColorPicker.ColorPanel.AutoSizePanel
member.summary:
This method is called internally to set the control's size.
If the Columns property is 0 then the control fixes it's width to the nearest number of columns that fit into the value returned by GetPreferredWidth.
If the Columns property is greater than 0 then the control will display that many columns.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.ColorPicker.ColorPanel.OnResize(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Overrides OnResize so the control can be auto-sized.
member.remarks: The control auto-sizes. It first fixes the width to the nearest whole multiple of the color well width, and then fixes the height to the nearest whole multiple of the color well height.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.ColorPicker.ColorPanelUserControl
member.summary: ColorPanelUserControl is used to host an instance of ColorPanel together with various options.
member.remarks:
This is the base control which is placed into the ColorPanelForm form to be dropped from the ColorPickerUserControl. Normally this control should not be placed as a standalone user control onto a form. It is public to be used if a replacement of the ColorPanelForm form is requiered.
This control uses the satellite assemblies to localize the labels. For that reason, the control should not be used without the satellites for all languages used in the final application. Otherwise a replacement string is used as the embedded default resource.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.ColorPicker.ColorPickerUserControl
member.summary: A Color picker control specialized for HTML colors.
member.remarks:
This is the basic color control. It provides a button to pop-up a color selection box, a textbox for entering colors as names or RGB values and a context menu for a few simple configuration options.
The control has two selection modes:
ColorPanel
ColorSlider
Whereas the ColorSlider supports the whole RGB space the ColorPanel has three specialized panes:
WebContains the 216 web safe colors as a grid.
CustomAllows the user to add his own color collection.
SystemThe standard system colors used by Windows.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.ColorPicker.ColorSlider
member.summary: A control that allows the user to select any color from the RGB color space.
member.remarks:
The control presents a 2 dimensional slice through the 3D color cube. The user may select Red, Green or Blue to be the z-axis where the z-axis extends into the screen and the x and y-axes are the remaining pair of colors. The control displays a 256x256 color palette calculated over the x and y axes combined with the selected z-axis value. This palette is varied continuously as the user changes the selected z-axis value.
The control is inpired from Peter McMahon's ColorPicker.NET.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.FontPicker.FontPickerBox
member.summary: This class builds the form for font selection.
member.remarks: The purpose to introduce a new font picker control is the possiblity to select multiple font at a time. This is used in styles (font-family attribute) and the (deprecated) <font> tag. The browser can select any font from list and it will take the first locally installed one. Such list make sense if we think for font lists as a fallback instruction. Typically the user will select a list like "Arial, Univers, Helvetice, Sans Serif". This assumes that the most people have Arial on their system. Some of us, using a Macintosh computer, have a similar font called Univers. And a few a professionals working with expensive high quality fonts like Helvetica. Any other exotic systems are probably able to provide a generic font like Sans Serif, which is in fact replaced with the best matching font without serifs.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.FontPicker.FontPickerUserControl.AllowDrop
member.summary: Allows the user to drop fonts onto the control.
member.remarks:
If dropping is allowed the listbox (not the entire control) will accept fontnames (if strings are the data) or font objects from which the string is extracted.
The control does not allow adding fonts more than once. If a font is added as string the whole string is treated as one name. To allow users to add multiple fonts at the same time use the data type FileDrop. The control expects that the path points to a TrueType or OpenType font which exists on the local computer. The name will than be added to the list. Font variants (Arial, Arial Bold, Arial Italics) are treated as one font and added only once, as long as the fonts have the same base font.
Note: The control cannot be used as a drop source in the current version.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.Ruler.RulerControl
member.summary: Creates a ruler, which can be placed either vertical or horizontal. RulerControl creates a simple but powerful ruler.
member.remarks:
The ruler has several features especially for designing HTML pages:
Show measures in pixel and point.
Define beginning of scale to respect scroll positions.
Show margins.
Show segments, for instance, show table columns/rows or selected object's boundaries.
Free setting of font, colors, and scales.
Screen and show mouse position.
Using various properties the ruler can be highly customized and used to present measures and boundaries of objects, set them interactively and fire events to change objects directly from ruler operations using the mouse.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.StyleEditor.StyleControl.OnContentChanged(System.Object)
member.summary: Fires the OnContentChanged event after each field change operation
member.remarks: Fires the OnContentChanged event after each field change operation regardless whether the new value is valid or allowed. Invalid values may be removed later during parsing and the event is fired again with the correct values. This means for the event handler that any action can fire many times, but the last one contains always correct values.
member.param: The control that has fired the event. Not used.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.StyleEditor.StyleControl.OnDragEnter(System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs)
member.summary: Fired if a drag enter event occurs.
member.remarks: This simply calls the base event handler and does not check the content beeing dragged.
member.param: The event arguments. If overridden in derived class the method should perform some actions on the data.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.UserInterface.StyleEditor.StyleControl.OnDragDrop(System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs)
member.summary: Fired if the control receives a drop event.
member.remarks: This method is called during a drop event. It gathers the data and tries to deserialize a text string from dragged data. If this is possible the StyleString fill be filled with the data without further investigation. The next change in the control may reduce the text to the recognizable parts.
member.param: The event arguments. If overridden in derived class the method should perform some actions on the data.
